result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelvin O Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Establish paternity.   Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders.  Do not drive unless properly licensed, proof of insurance, and permission from agent.  No contact with A.P. or S.P. (person, property, residence or family).   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

AMENDED 01-04-2019:  Restitution to be set at zero based on the record made at the hearing on 01-04-2019.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim, AP (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 12-17-2015: DEFENDANT MAY TO GO RACINE PUBLIC LIBRARY FROM 1:00 PM TO 3:00 PM AT 75 7TH ST, RACINE, WI ON MONDAY'S AND WEDNESDAY'S FOR THE SOLE PURPOSE OF USING THE PUBLIC INTERNET FOR WORK SEARCH. dEFENDANT SHALL ATTEND ANY FORMAL, VERIFIABLE INTERVIEW AND SHALL BE ALLOWED TO GO TO AND FROM SUBSEQUENT EMPLOYMENT. ALL INTERVIEWS AND WORK SCHEDULED MUST BE PROVIDED TO AND CONFIRMED BY ZCI PRIOR TO THE DEFENDANT LEAVING HIS RESIDENCE.

to modify bond to allow deft to go to Racine Public Library from 1:00 - 3:00 pm only on Monday and Wednesdays for the sole purpose of using public internet for work search purposes, deft may attend any formal, verifiable interview and be allowed to go to and from any successfully obtained employment. All interviews and full employment schedule must be provided and confirmed with ZCI prior to defendant leaving his residence.
